channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [PDFBOX-3067] Text strings being returned as single characters, regression from version 1.8
item.description:
PrintTextLocations writestring() is returning individual characters on this file, rather than a complete string. Was returning strings with '-200,000' in version 1.8

Also note that textposition.getWidthOfSpace() is getting a negative value (-4.464) for each character. Don't know if that is symptom or a cause.
item.summary: Text strings being returned as single characters, regression from version 1.8

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Commit 1711070 from Tilman Hausherr in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1711070 ]

PDFBOX-3067: don't multiply with horizontalScalingText, as this has already been done before
"horizontalScalingText" is used twice, same bug as in PDFBOX-3042, see extended explanation there.

Commit 1711071 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1711071 ]

PDFBOX-3067: add test files
Thanks. I also added a PDF test file to our tests, not identical but based on the problem in your file (negative Tf value).

I see that 3067 <https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PDFBOX-3067> is
closed as fixed, as is another issue that it references, 3042
<https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PDFBOX-3042>

But I am still seeing the issue on the testfile I submitted for 3067 with
the latest dvlp build pdfbox-app-2.0.0-20151029.061737-1766.jar
<https://repository.apache.org/content/groups/snapshots/org/apache/pdfbox/pdfbox-app/2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/pdfbox-app-2.0.0-20151029.061737-1766.jar>

Am I missing something, or should this be re-opened?

Thanks

On Wed, Oct 28, 2015 at 10:29 AM, Tilman Hausherr (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>

I got this with ExtractText for the file singlecharacters.pdf:

-200,000.00
-200,000.00

Is that what you meant?

Yes.

And I also downloaded from the link you meant, and did get "-200,000.00" with ExtractText. So unless I'm terribly mistaken somewhere, I suspect you've mixed up your libraries...

Ok, I think we have been confusing two different things. And I believe
there still is a problem.

I am overiding writeString, not processTextPosition. PrintTextLocations
for 2.0 has writeString, for 1.8 has processTextPostion, and neither seems
to show the strings rather than positions. I have modified the
PrintTextLocations code slightly to show strings rather than each text
position, and also added widthofspace, which is not printed out in the
trunk version.

So my modified code for PrintTextLocations.writeString is as follows
(original lines commented out)

TextPosition text = textPositions.get(0);
// for (TextPosition text : textPositions)
//

{ System.out.println( string + " @[" + text.getXDirAdj() + "," + text.getYDirAdj() + " type=" + text.getFont().getSubType() + " fs=" + text.getFontSize() + " xscale=" + text.getXScale() + " height=" + text.getHeightDir() + " space=" + text.getWidthOfSpace() + " width=" + text.getWidthDirAdj() + " widthofspace=" + text.getWidthOfSpace() + "]" ); // }

I also moved that code back into 1.8.9 PrintTextLocations

In 1.8 I get

-200,000.00 @[363.94,491.34 type=TrueType fs=-12.0 xscale=7.44
height=4.6537204 space=4.464 width=4.4639893 widthofspace=4.464]
-200,000.00 @[363.94,522.33997 type=TrueType fs=-12.0 xscale=7.44
height=4.6537204 space=4.464 width=4.4639893 widthofspace=4.464]

In the latest 2.0 I get

  • @[363.94,491.34 type=TrueType fs=-12.0 xscale=7.44

On Thu, Oct 29, 2015 at 10:03 AM, Tilman Hausherr (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>

very mysterious... because with your code, I get

-200,000.00         @[363.94,491.34 type=TrueType fs=-12.0 xscale=7.44 height=6.3265433space=4.464 width=4.4639893 widthofspace=4.464]
-200,000.00         @[363.94,522.33997 type=TrueType fs=-12.0 xscale=7.44 height=6.3265433space=4.464 width=4.4639893 widthofspace=4.464]

I then opened a new project with the jar you mention, and have the same results (file attached)

-200,000.00         @[363.94,491.34 type=TrueType fs=-12.0 xscale=7.44 height=6.3265433space=4.464 width=4.4639893 widthofspace=4.464]
-200,000.00         @[363.94,522.33997 type=TrueType fs=-12.0 xscale=7.44 height=6.3265433space=4.464 width=4.4639893 widthofspace=4.464]

Well I downloaded the pdfbox source and built with that, and then am
getting the same (good) results you are. So it must be something in my
IDE, will have to figure how that can be happening.

Sorry for wasting your time on that.

On Thu, Oct 29, 2015 at 11:44 AM, Tilman Hausherr (JIRA) <jira@apache.org>
